documents.content:
# California Child Care Assistance Programs (Non-CalWORKs) 2025-26

## General Child Care Programs

For families NOT receiving CalWORKs cash assistance:

### General Child Care and Development (CCTR)
- **Income limit:** 85% SMI
- **Entitlement:** Yes - no waiting list
- **Need requirement:** Must demonstrate need (employment, education, training)
- **Provider choice:** Voucher-based - choose your own provider

### Alternative Payment Program (CAPP)
- **Income limit:** 85% SMI
- **Entitlement:** May have waiting lists depending on funding
- **Need requirement:** Must demonstrate need
- **Provider choice:** Maximum flexibility - licensed or license-exempt

### California State Preschool Program (CSPP)
- **Income limit:** 100% SMI (higher than other programs!)
- **Need requirement:** None for part-day; need demonstrated for full-day
- **Age:** 3-4 year olds (2-year-olds through July 2027)
- **Provider:** Center-based only (Title 5 standards)

## 2025-26 Income Limits (85% SMI)

| Family Size | Monthly Limit |
|-------------|---------------|
| 2 persons | $6,860 |
| 3 persons | $7,785 |
| 4 persons | $9,020 |
| 5 persons | $10,463 |

## Who Qualifies Without Income Test?

- Foster children (eligible regardless of family income)
- Children receiving Child Protective Services
- Children identified as at-risk of abuse/neglect
- Homeless families

## 24-Month Continuous Eligibility

Once enrolled, you keep child care for 24 months without reporting changes UNLESS:
- You qualified based on income AND
- Your income exceeds 85% SMI

## How to Apply

1. Visit rrnetwork.org
2. Enter your zip code to find local resources
3. Contact your local Child Care Resource & Referral agency
4. Complete application with income documentation

**More Info:** https://rrnetwork.org/family-services/paying-for-childcare
